canDo: I can talk about my future plans and intentions.

grammar.point: Future Tense: will, be going to, present continuous for future

rules.title: Will for decisions and predictions
rules.explanation: Use 'will' for spontaneous decisions and predictions about the future.
examples: I think it will rain tomorrow.
She will be a great doctor.
rules.koreanTip: 'will'은 즉흥적 결정이나 예측에 써요. 'I'll'은 'I will'의 축약형이에요.

rules.title: Be going to for plans and intentions
rules.explanation: Use 'be going to' for planned actions and strong intentions.
examples: I'm going to study abroad next year.
She's going to visit her parents.
We're going to have a party.
rules.koreanTip: 'be going to'는 이미 계획한 일에 써요. '~할 거야'라는 의도를 나타내요.

rules.title: Present continuous for scheduled events
rules.explanation: Use present continuous for definite arrangements in the near future.
examples: We're flying to Japan next week.
She's starting a new job on Monday.
rules.koreanTip: 확정된 일정에는 현재진행형을 써요. 약속이 잡힌 경우에 사용합니다.

exercises.question: Look at those dark clouds. I think it ___ rain.
exercises.explanation: Use 'is going to' when there's present evidence for a future event.
exercises.koreanTip: 현재 증거(먹구름)가 있을 때는 'be going to'를 써요.

exercises.question: I've decided. I ___ learn Spanish this year.
exercises.explanation: Use 'be going to' for decisions made before speaking.
exercises.koreanTip: 말하기 전에 이미 결정한 것은 'be going to'를 써요.

exercises.question: A: The phone is ringing. B: I ___ answer it.
exercises.explanation: Use 'will' for spontaneous decisions made at the moment of speaking.

exercises.question: Which sentence shows a definite arrangement?
exercises.explanation: Present continuous + specific time shows a definite arrangement.

words.meaning: an intention or decision about what to do
examples: What are your plans for the weekend?
I'm planning to move next month.
My goal is to become a doctor.

words.meaning: a list of planned activities or events
examples: The meeting is scheduled for 3 PM.

words.meaning: a formal arrangement to meet someone
examples: I have a doctor's appointment at 10 AM.
words.koreanTip: 공식적인 약속(병원, 미팅 등)에 쓰는 표현이에요

examples: I have no intention of quitting.
words.koreanTip: 'have the intention to'로 '~할 의향이 있다'를 표현해요

reading.title: New Year's Resolutions
reading.passage: Every January, people around the world make New Year's resolutions. These are promises to improve themselves in the coming year. My friend Sarah has big plans for this year. She's going to start exercising three times a week. She will also learn to cook healthy meals. 'I'm joining a gym next Monday,' she told me excitedly. Her brother Tom has different goals. He's planning to save money and travel to Europe. 'I'll visit at least five countries,' he said confidently. As for me, I'm going to read more books and spend less time on my phone. Will we keep our resolutions? Only time will tell!

questions.question: What is Sarah going to do?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'She's going to start exercising three times a week.'

questions.question: What is Tom's goal?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'He's planning to save money and travel to Europe.'

questions.question: What does 'resolution' mean?
questions.explanation: 'Resolution' in this context means a promise or decision to do something better.

listening.title: Planning a Birthday Party
listening.script: Hi Mom! I'm calling to tell you about my plans. I'm going to have a birthday party next Saturday. I've already invited fifteen friends. The party is going to be at home. I'll order pizza and make a cake. My friend will bring a DJ set, so we're going to have great music. I'm also planning to decorate the living room with balloons. It's going to be so much fun! Can you come? I hope you will!

exercises.question: When is the birthday party?
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'I'm going to have a birthday party next Saturday.'

exercises.question: The speaker will ___ and make a cake.
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'I'll order pizza and make a cake.'

template.prompt: Write about your plans for this weekend using the template.
template.template: This weekend, I'm going to [ACTIVITY1]. On Saturday, I will [ACTIVITY2] in the [TIME]. On Sunday, I'm [SCHEDULED_EVENT]. I hope it will be [ADJECTIVE]!
template.correctExample: This weekend, I'm going to visit my grandparents. On Saturday, I will have lunch with them in the afternoon. On Sunday, I'm meeting my friends at the cafe. I hope it will be fun!

free.prompt: Write about your goals and plans for this year. Use 'will', 'be going to', and present continuous for future at least once each.

checklist.item: Use 'be going to' at least once
Use present continuous for a scheduled event
Describe at least 3 goals or plans

shadowing.sentence: I'm going to study hard this semester, and I will try to get better grades than last year.
shadowing.pronunciation: /aɪm ˈɡoʊɪŋ tuː ˈstʌdi hɑːrd ðɪs sɪˈmestər ænd aɪ wɪl traɪ tuː ɡet ˈbetər ɡreɪdz ðæn læst jɪr/
shadowing.koreanTip: 'going to'는 구어체에서 'gonna'처럼 발음되기도 해요. 하지만 공식적인 상황에서는 정확히 발음하세요.

roleplay.scenario: You are discussing weekend plans with a friend.

prompts.speaker: partner
prompts.text: Do you have any plans for the weekend?

prompts.speaker: partner
prompts.text: Want to meet for coffee after?

prompts.speaker: user
prompts.text: Sure! I'll ___ you when I'm done.

koreanErrors.errorExample: I will going to the party.
koreanErrors.correctForm: I will go to the party. / I'm going to go to the party.
koreanErrors.explanation: Don't combine 'will' and 'going to'. Choose one.
koreanErrors.tip: 'will'과 'be going to'를 동시에 쓰지 마세요. 둘 중 하나만 선택하세요!

koreanErrors.errorExample: I will meet him tomorrow at 3 PM. (Already scheduled)
koreanErrors.correctForm: I'm meeting him tomorrow at 3 PM.
koreanErrors.explanation: For definite arrangements with a set time, use present continuous.
koreanErrors.tip: 이미 확정된 약속은 현재진행형으로 표현해요. 'I'm meeting him'이 더 자연스러워요.

koreanErrors.errorExample: I'm going to study = 아임 고잉 투 스터디
koreanErrors.explanation: In natural speech, 'to' is often reduced to /tə/ before a verb.
